ThingDef.label: Henry .45-70 "Tornado"
ThingDef.description: A lever-action rifle for long range hunting, medium-sized game or a raider...

ThingDef.label: M1 Carbine
ThingDef.description: The M1 carbine (formally the United States Carbine, Caliber .30, M1) is a lightweight semi-automatic carbine that was used widely by paramilitary and police forces around the world, now the gun seem to become popular in the Rim.

ThingDef.label: M1A1 Carbine
ThingDef.description: A more compact version of the M1, feature a metal folding stock.

ThingDef.label: M2 Carbine
ThingDef.description: The automatic version of the M1, because you want to spray lead down range.

ThingDef.label: M1 Garand .280
ThingDef.description: Caliber: .280 British. 8-round internal mag. Semi-Automatic.

ThingDef.label: Kel-Tec RDB
ThingDef.description: The Kel-Tec RDB (Rifle, Downward-ejection, Bullpup) is a bullpup carbine offered in 5.56x45mm NATO semi-automatic rifle, manufactured by Kel-Tec Industries of Florida. It uses a rotary bolt with a spring loaded ejector and an extractor facing down, ejecting spent shell casings downward, allowing easy ambidextrous use.

ThingDef.label: Kel-Tec RDB (mod)
ThingDef.description: The Kel-Tec RDB (Rifle, Downward-ejection, Bullpup) is a bullpup carbine offered in 5.56x45mm NATO semi-automatic rifle, manufactured by Kel-Tec Industries of Florida. It uses a rotary bolt with a spring loaded ejector and an extractor facing down, ejecting spent shell casings downward, allowing easy ambidextrous use.

ThingDef.label: Kel-Tec RFB
ThingDef.description: The Kel-Tec RFB (Rifle, Forward-ejection, Bullpup) is a gas-operated bullpup type semi-automatic rifle, manufactured by Kel-Tec Industries of Florida.

ThingDef.label: Kel-Tec RFB (mod)
ThingDef.description: The Kel-Tec RFB (Rifle, Forward-ejection, Bullpup) is a gas-operated bullpup type semi-automatic rifle, manufactured by Kel-Tec Industries of Florida.

ThingDef.label: SVD Dragunov
ThingDef.description: SVD: Ancient semi-automatic sniper rifle. Accurate, relatively lightweight, and chambered in the battle-proven 7.62x54mmR cartridge. The SVD acts more like a DMR than a sniper rifle, effective at both medium and long ranges.

ThingDef.label: SVU-A Dragunov
ThingDef.description: SVU-A. Dragunov pattern rifle made into a bullpup configuration to operate better in tight spaces, such as apartment blocks. The gun also has a select fire trigger group, but controllability and accuracy in full-auto are questionable at best.

ThingDef.label: M1A
ThingDef.description: A Semi-Auto Rifle that shoot a powerful .308 caliber.

ThingDef.label: Archangel M1A
ThingDef.description: The descendant of the classic M1 Garand. This M1A comes with a 30 round mag, a HAMR scope and a slick looking Archangel stock.

ThingDef.label: M14 DMR
ThingDef.description:
The M14 rifle, officially the United States Rifle, 7.62 mm, M14, is an American automatic rifle that fires 7.62Ã—51mm NATO (.308 in) ammunition.
It became the standard-issued rifle for the U.S. military in 1959 replacing the M1 Garand rifle in the U.S. Army by 1961 and the U.S. Marine Corps by 1965 until being replaced by the M16 rifle beginning in 1964.

ThingDef.label: M82A1
ThingDef.description:
The Barrett M82, standardized by the U.S. military as the M107, is a recoil-operated, semi-automatic anti-materiel sniper system developed by the American Barrett Firearms Manufacturing company. Despite its designation as an anti-materiel rifle, it is used by some armed forces as an anti-personnel system.
It is also called the Light Fifty for its .50 BMG (12.7Ã—99mm NATO) chambering and significantly lighter weight compared to previous applications.

ThingDef.label: GM6 Lynx
ThingDef.description: If the government only lets you own 5 round mag rifles may as well make each bullet count. The GM6 is a light bullpup anti-material .50 BMG semi-automatic rifle that allows the possibility of off hand firing.

ThingDef.label: PSG-1
ThingDef.description:
The PSG1 (PrÃ¤zisionsschÃ¼tzengewehr, German for "precision shooter rifle") is a semi-automatic sniper rifle designed and produced by the German company Heckler and Koch of Oberndorf am Neckar.
This rifle is said to have been developed in response to the Munich massacre at the 1972 Summer Olympics. The West German police units could not engage the terrorists quickly enough to prevent them from killing their hostages. HK was then commissioned to create a high accuracy, large magazine capacity, semi-automatic rifle for police and military use.

ThingDef.label: VSS Vintorez
ThingDef.description:
The VSS (Russian: Ð’Ð¸Ð½Ñ‚Ð¾Ð²ÐºÐ° Ð¡Ð½Ð°Ð¹Ð¿ÐµÑ€ÑÐºÐ°Ñ Ð¡Ð¿ÐµÑ†Ð¸Ð°Ð»ÑŒÐ½Ð°Ñ, Vintovka Snayperskaya Spetsialnaya or "Special Sniper Rifle", GRAU designation 6P29), also called the Vintorez ("thread cutter"/"tap"), is a suppressed sniper rifle that uses a heavy subsonic 9Ã—39mm SP5 cartridge and armor-piercing SP6 cartridge.
It was developed in the late 1980s by TsNIITochMash and manufactured by the Tula Arsenal. It is issued primarily to Spetsnaz units for undercover or clandestine operations, a role made evident by its ability to be stripped down for transport in a specially fitted briefcase

ThingDef.label: WA 2000
ThingDef.description:
The Walther WA 2000 is a semi-automatic bullpup sniper rifle that was produced by the Carl Walther GmbH Sportwaffen company. It was produced in three different calibers. Production of the rifle was limited and it was shortly stopped because it was too expensive to achieve widespread sales and not robust enough for military use as a sniper rifle.
Only 176 were built due to its high cost, making it one of the rarest and most sought production firearms ever made. The Walther WA 2000 is extremely rare and valuable.
The WA 2000 was designed in the late 1970s and early 1980s, in response to the 1972 Summer Olympics Munich massacre.

ThingDef.label: SKS "Interchange"
ThingDef.description: A Tapco SKS with built on a budget, rumors said a certain TMC guy used it to raid a Mall for stew cans.

ThingDef.label: G28
ThingDef.description:
The civilian MR308 was used to develop the G28, a designated marksman rifle for the German Bundeswehr (Federal Army) deployment to the War in Afghanistan.
The semi-automatic G28 is chambered for 7.62Ã—51mm NATO and has a factory warrantied accuracy of 45 mm dispersion at 100 meters (0.45 mil or 1.5 moa) when fired with 10 rounds using OTM/HPBT/Sierra Match King ammunition.

ThingDef.label: L129A1
ThingDef.description:
The L129A1 Sharpshooter is a marksman's rifle that has been fielded by UK forces since late 2010.
The weapon was procured in order to fill a capability gap identified by experience in Afghanistan, where British infantry units were often engaged by small arms fire from outside the range of their own assault rifles and light machine guns.

ThingDef.label: Mk 14 Mod 0
ThingDef.description:
The Mk 14 Enhanced Battle Rifle (EBR) is an American selective fire military designated marksman rifle chambered for the 7.62Ã—51mm NATO cartridge.
It is a variant of the M14 battle rifle and was originally built for use with units of United States Special Operations Command, such as the United States Navy SEALs, Delta Force, and task specific ODA teams/units.

ThingDef.label: SKS "DMR"
ThingDef.description:
The SKS is a Soviet semi-automatic carbine chambered for the 7.62Ã—39mm round, designed in 1943 by Sergei Gavrilovich Simonov. Its complete designation, SKS-45, is an initialism for Samozaryadny Karabin sistemy Simonova, 1945 (Russian: Ð¡Ð°Ð¼Ð¾Ð·Ð°Ñ€ÑÐ´Ð½Ñ‹Ð¹ ÐºÐ°Ñ€Ð°Ð±Ð¸Ð½ ÑÐ¸ÑÑ‚ÐµÐ¼Ñ‹ Ð¡Ð¸Ð¼Ð¾Ð½Ð¾Ð²Ð°, 1945; Self-loading Carbine of (the) Simonov system, 1945).
The SKS-45 was manufactured at Tula Arsenal from 1949 to 1958 and at Izhevsk Arsenal in just 1953 and 1954, resulting in a total Soviet production of about 2.7 million carbines.

ThingDef.label: MK18 Mjolnir (Thermal scope)
ThingDef.description: A Semi-Auto Rifle chambered in .338 Lapua magnum, equiped with a thermal scope for easier targeting. Good damage and penetration but it size, semi-auto only, slow rate of fire and production cost hinders it ability in close range.(This weapon has NVG stats if Combat Extended is loaded).
